sect1.title: LIMIT

row.entry: The set of records to limit. This may be an INDEX or any expression that produces a recordset result.
The maximum number of records allowed on a single supercomputer node.
Optional. A standard FAIL workflow service call.
Optional. Specifies limiting the keyed portion of an INDEX read.
Optional. Specifies the KEYED limit is pre-checked using keyspan.
Optional. Specifies that when the limit is exceeded it is simply eliminated from any result instead of failing the workunit.
Optional. Specifies outputting a single record produced by the transform instead of failing the workunit.
The TRANSFORM function to call to produce the single output record.

sect1.para: The LIMIT function causes the attribute to fail with an exception if the recset contains more records than maxrecs on any single node of the supercomputer (unless the SKIP option is used for an index read or the ONFAIL option is present). If the failclause is present, it specifies the exception number and message. This is typically used to control "runaway" queries in the Rapid Data Delivery Engine supercomputer.
